file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-26-02-04 - CONFIG-1 - RH WARDROBE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL RH WARDROBE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH RH WARDROBE 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the RH wardrobe assembly. B. The RH wardrobe is installed in the passenger cabin, at zone 232. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH RH 25-26-02-000-801-A RH WARDROBE - REMOVAL WARDROBE AIRCRAFT WITH RH 25-26-02-400-801-A RH WARDROBE - INSTALLATION WARDROBE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 25-26-02 Page 1 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-26-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH RH WARDROBE 2. RH WARDROBE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the RH wardrobe assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-01-000-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-01-000-803-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-01-000-804-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin 1 Helps the other technician Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-009-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Empty the RH wardrobe. (3) Remove the forward galley assembly (AMM TASK 25-30-01-000-801-A/400), (AMM TASK 25-30-01-000-802-A/400), (AMM TASK 25-30-01-000-803-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-30-01-000-804-A/400), as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 25-26-02 Page 2 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Remove the main-door region ceiling panel (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (5) Remove the emergency equipment from the RH wardrobe. (6) Remove the sealant from the interface of the RH wardrobe bottom edge with the aisle floor. J. RH Wardrobe with center-parting door - Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-010-B EFFECTIVITY: RH WARDROBE WITH CENTER-PARTING DOOR (1) Open the miscellaneous door (2). Refer to DET. A. (2) Remove the screw (7) and washer (8). Refer to DET. B. (3) Remove the screws (4) and washers (3). Refer to DET. A. (4) Close the miscellaneous door (2). (5) Open the door (9). (6) Remove the screws (5) and washers (6). Refer to DET. C. (7) Close the door (9). Refer to DET. A. (8) Remove the RH wardrobe (1). K. RH Wardrobe with RH-opening foldable door - Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-011-A EFFECTIVITY: RH WARDROBE WITH RH-OPENING FOLDABLE DOOR (1) Remove the sealant from the interface of the RH wardrobe (3) bottom edge with the floor. (2) Open the door (7) of the RH wardrobe (3). (3) Remove the floor fitting covers (14) that is attached with the screws (15). Refer to DET. C. (4) Remove the bolts (13) and washers (12) that attach the RH wardrobe (3) to the floor. (5) Remove the access panel (6) that is attached with the screws (5). Refer to DET. A. (6) Remove the bolts (11) and washers (10) that attach the RH wardrobe (3). (7) Close the door (7) of the RH wardrobe (3). (8) Open the miscellaneous door (4). (9) Remove the access plate (9) that is attached with the screws (8). Refer to DET. B. (10) Remove the bolt (2), washers (1) and (16), and nut (17) to disconnect the tie rod (18) from the aircraft structure. Refer to DET. A. (11) Close the miscellaneous door (4). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 25-26-02 Page 3 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (12) To remove the RH wardrobe (3) from the aircraft, it is necessary to divide it into two portions, the front portion and the rear portion. For this, do the steps below: (a) Open the door (7). (b) Remove the coat rod (22) that is attached with the screws (19). (c) Remove the panel (20) with the screws (21). (d) Remove the screws (30) that attach the door tracks (23) to the rear portion of the RH wardrobe (3). (e) Remove the painted-red screws (29), (31), and (32) from the RH wardrobe (3). Refer to DET. D. (f) Remove the fitting covers (24). Refer to DET. E. (g) Remove the screws (25), washers (26), and nuts (28) that attach the fittings (27). (13) Remove the the both parts of the RH wardrobe (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 25-26-02 Page 4 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

SCREW (4) ZONE B 232 9. DOOR C 1 DET. A 6. WASHER (7) 5. SCREW (7) DET. C 1 SEALANT 8. WASHER 7. SCREW DET. WASHER 4. MISCELLANEOUS 2. BOLT DOOR 18. TIE ROD 17. NUT 14. FLOOR 15. SCREW 16. WASHER FITTING COVER 13. BOLT 12. WASHER B 11. BOLT DET. C 10. WASHER 5. SCREW 6. ACCESS PANEL 9. ACCESS PLATE 7. SCREW E E 27. FITTING 23. DOOR TRACK 22. COATROD DET. D 21. SCREW 28. NUT 26. WASHER 20. PANEL 25. SCREW 24. FITTING COVER DET. E 145AMM250342.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 25-26-02 Page 7 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-26-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH RH WARDROBE 3. RH WARDROBE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the RH wardrobe assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-01-400-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-01-400-803-A/400 - SRM 51-20-01 - TASK 25-22-04-400-804-A - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) RTV 780 (Black) Sealant AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin 1 Helps the other technician Passenger cabin I. RH Wardrobe with center-parting door - Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-010-B EFFECTIVITY: RH WARDROBE WITH CENTER-PARTING DOOR (1) Remove the sealant residues (SRM 51-20-01) from the related area. Refer to DET. A. (2) Put the RH wardrobe (1) in its installation position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 25-26-02 Page 8 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Open the miscellaneous door (2). (4) Install the screws (4) and washers (3). (5) Install the screw (7) and washer (8). Refer to DET. B. (6) Close the miscellaneous door (2). Refer to DET. A. (7) Open the door (9). (8) Install the screws (5) and washers (6). Refer to DET. C. (9) Close the door (9). J. RH Wardrobe with RH-opening foldable door - Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-011-A EFFECTIVITY: RH WARDROBE WITH RH-OPENING FOLDABLE DOOR (1) If you disassembled the RH wardrobe, do steps (a) thru (f) below: (a) Put the parts of the RH wardrobe (3) into the aircraft. Refer to DET. A. (b) Put the parts of the RH wardrobe (3) together and attach them as follows: 1 Attach the fittings (27) with the screws (25), washers (26), and nuts (28). Refer to DET. E. 2 Attach the painted-red screws (29), (31), and (32). Refer to DET. D. (c) Install the fitting covers (24). Refer to DET. E. (d) Attach the door tracks (23) to the rear portion of the RH wardrobe (3) with the screws (30). Refer to DET. D. (e) Install the panel (20) with the screws (21). (f) Install the coat rod (22) with the screws (19). (2) Remove the sealant residues (SRM 51-20-01) from the related area. Refer to DET. A. (3) Put the RH wardrobe (3) assembly in its installation position. (4) Open the door (7) of the RH wardrobe (3). (5) Attach the RH wardrobe (3) with the bolts (11) and washers (10). (6) Attach the RH wardrobe (3) to the floor with the bolts (13) and washers (12). Refer to DET. C. (7) Install the floor fitting covers (14) with the screws (15). (8) Install the access panel (6) with the screws (5). Refer to DET. A. (9) Close the door (7) of the RH wardrobe (3). (10) Open the miscellaneous door (4). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 25-26-02 Page 9 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (11) Install the bolt (2), washers (1) and (16), and nut (17) that attach the tie rod assembly (18) to the aircraft structure. (12) Install the access plate (9) with the screws (8). Refer to DET. B. (13) Close the miscellaneous door (4). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-009-B (1) Install the forward galley assembly (AMM TASK 25-30-01-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-30-01-400-803-A/400), as applicable. (2) Install the main-door region ceiling panel (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-801-A/400), (AMM TASK 25-30-01-400-802-A/400), (AMM TASK 25-30-01-400-803-A/400) or (TASK 25-22-04-400-804-A), as applicable. (3) Install the emergency equipment into the RH wardrobe. (4) Apply the sealant to the interface of the RH wardrobe bottom edge with the aisle floor (Figure 401) (SRM 51-20-01). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 25-26-02 Page 10 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
